column1: Noor is working as a barista at a busy coffee shop. Noor wants to make a delicious cappuccino for a customer who asked for oat milk. Noor grabs a milk container and fills it with oat milk. A coworker, who didn't hear the customer's request, swaps the oat milk in the container with almond milk while Noor is attending to another task. Noor sees her coworker swapping the milk.
column2: Does Noor believe the milk pitcher contains oat milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor believes the milk pitcher contains almond milk.
column4: Noor believes the milk pitcher contains oat milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The plaque next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the plaque carefully. A gallery staff member, realizing there was a mix-up, changes the plaque with the correct information attributing the painting to an emerging artist instead. Zara reads the updated plaque carefully.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a famous artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of a famous artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a small village in Mexico, tending to his cornfield. He wants to irrigate his crops by opening a water gate connected to a nearby river. Carlos closed the gate the previous evening. During the night, heavy rainfall caused the river to overflow, opening the gate and flooding the cornfield. Carlos sees the flooded cornfield.
column2: Does Carlos believe the water valve is closed or open?
column3: Carlos believes the water valve is open.
column4: Carlos believes the water valve is closed.

column1: Kofi is a fisherman from a small village in Ghana. He wants to catch enough fish today to provide for his family and sell the surplus at the market. Kofi repaired his fishing trap last night. While Kofi is away from his boat, a group of monkeys comes and plays with the fishing trap, tearing it apart. Kofi observes the monkeys damaging his fishing trap.
column2: Does Kofi believe his fishing net is in good condition or torn apart?
column3: Kofi believes his fishing net is torn apart.
column4: Kofi believes his fishing net is in good condition.

column1: Azola is a teacher at a small school in rural China. She wants to surprise her students with a new book for the school library. Azola got a notification from Amazon stating that the parcel containing the book was left at her doorstep. A gust of wind blows the parcel off her doorstep, and a neighbor replaces it with a different parcel containing a hand-knit scarf. Azola witnesses the parcel swap.
column2: Does Azola believe the package contains the book she ordered or a hand-knit scarf?
column3: Azola believes the package contains a hand-knit scarf.
column4: Azola believes the package contains the book she ordered.

column1: Ravi is a farmer in a small Indian village, tending to his mango orchard. Ravi wants to harvest ripe mangoes to sell at the local market. He notices a mango tree with a heavy limb laden with ripe mangoes. A mischievous monkey comes along and eats all the ripe mangoes on the limb while Ravi is gathering his harvesting tools. Ravi sees the monkey eating the ripe mangoes.
column2: Does Ravi believe the branch has ripe mangoes or no ripe mangoes?
column3: Ravi believes the branch has no ripe mangoes.
column4: Ravi believes the branch has ripe mangoes.

column1: Kofi is a chef at a popular Ghanaian restaurant. Kofi wants to prepare a traditional groundnut soup for the dinner menu. Kofi adds a small jar of peanut butter to the soup pot on the stove. An apprentice chef, mistakenly thinking it was a seasoning paste, removes the peanut butter from the soup and replaces it with tomato paste. Kofi notices the apprentice chef swapping the ingredients.
column2: Does Kofi believe the soup contains peanut butter or tomato paste?
column3: Kofi believes the soup contains tomato paste.
column4: Kofi believes the soup contains peanut butter.

column1: Kael is a farmer in a remote village in the Andes. Kael wants to plant a new crop of high-altitude potatoes in one of his terraced plots. The soil in the plot appears rich and well-fertilized. Overnight, heavy rainfall washes away much of the fertile soil, leaving mostly rocky dirt behind. Kael notices the change in the soil after the rainfall.
column2: Does Kael believe the soil is rich and well-fertilized or mostly rocky dirt?
column3: Kael believes the soil is mostly rocky dirt.
column4: Kael believes the soil is rich and well-fertilized.

column1: Farhan is a street food vendor in a bustling market in Istanbul. Farhan wants to prepare a delicious chicken shawarma wrap for a customer who asked for extra garlic sauce. Farhan takes a jar of garlic sauce from the shelf and pours it onto the shawarma wrap. His assistant, who is busy preparing a different wrap, accidentally swaps the garlic sauce with a jar of hot sauce, and Farhan unknowingly pours the hot sauce onto the shawarma wrap. Farhan notices the sauce swap.
column2: Does Farhan believe the sauce he poured is garlic sauce or hot sauce?
column3: Farhan believes the sauce he poured is hot sauce.
column4: Farhan believes the sauce he poured is garlic sauce.

column1: Abhay is a young farmer in a small Indian village. He wants to water his crops with the water stored in a large clay jar. Abhay checks the water level and sees that the jar is full. Unbeknownst to him, a hole in the bottom of the jar has caused the water to leak out, leaving the jar empty. Abhay notices the hole and the water leaking out.
column2: Does Abhay believe the pot is full of water or empty?
column3: Abhay believes the pot is empty.
column4: Abhay believes the pot is full of water.

column1: Aniket is a marine biologist studying coral reefs off the coast of India. Aniket needs to collect samples of coral to analyze the effects of climate change on the reef. Aniket spots a healthy-looking coral formation in a specific area of the reef. A sudden wave surge stirs up debris, covering the once healthy coral formation and causing it to become damaged. Aniket notices the wave surge and the debris covering the coral.
column2: Does Aniket believe the coral formation is healthy or damaged?
column3: Aniket believes the coral formation is damaged.
column4: Aniket believes the coral formation is healthy.

column1: Lila is a beekeeper in a small village in Eastern Europe. She wants to harvest honey from one of her honeycombs. The honeycomb is full of honey, as Lila observed during her last inspection. A sudden cold snap occurs overnight, causing the bees to consume the honey to stay warm and survive, leaving the honeycomb nearly empty. Lila notices the cold snap and the decreased honey in her honeycomb.
column2: Does Lila believe the beehive is full of honey or nearly empty?
column3: Lila believes the beehive is nearly empty.
column4: Lila believes the beehive is full of honey.

column1: Kavi is a chef at a popular Indian restaurant in a bustling city. Kavi wants to make his signature dish, a spicy curry, for the customers tonight. Kavi checks the pantry and sees a full jar of his favorite hot sauce. When Kavi is away, a new chef accidentally knocks over the hot sauce, spilling its contents all over the floor. Kavi sees the spilled hot sauce on the floor.
column2: Does Kavi believe there is a full bottle of hot sauce available or that the hot sauce has been spilled?
column3: Kavi believes the hot sauce has been spilled.
column4: Kavi believes there is a full bottle of hot sauce available.

column1: Hiroshi is a fisherman in a small coastal village in Japan. Hiroshi wants to catch some fish to provide dinner for his family. Hiroshi checks the weather report and sees that it will be sunny throughout the day. Suddenly, a heavy rainstorm moves in, darkening the sky and causing strong waves. Hiroshi notices the rainstorm approaching.
column2: Does Hiroshi believe the weather will be sunny or does he expect a rainstorm?
column3: Hiroshi believes there will be a rainstorm.
column4: Hiroshi believes the weather will be sunny all day.

column1: Juan is a young chef in a small Mexican town. He wants to make a delicious salsa for the upcoming town festival. Juan buys fresh tomatoes from the market, which he believes are ripe and perfect for the salsa. While Juan is away from his kitchen, a mischievous cat knocks over the basket of tomatoes, crushing them and making them unsuitable for the salsa. Juan notices the crushed tomatoes on the floor.
column2: Does Juan believe the tomatoes are ripe and perfect or crushed and unsuitable?
column3: Juan believes the tomatoes are crushed and unsuitable.
column4: Juan believes the tomatoes are ripe and perfect.

column1: Mei is a florist in a small town in Japan. She wants to create a beautiful bouquet using fresh flowers from her garden. Mei notices that her roses are in full bloom, with vibrant colors. Overnight, a sudden frost damages the roses, causing them to wilt and lose their vibrancy. Mei sees the wilted roses in her flower bed the next morning.
column2: Does Mei believe the roses in her garden are in full bloom or wilted?
column3: Mei believes the roses are wilted.
column4: Mei believes the roses are in full bloom.

column1: Juanita is a skilled chef who owns a small restaurant in Mexico. Today, she wants to prepare her signature dish, chiles en nogada, for a group of tourists. Juanita finds the last jar of walnuts she needs for the dish in the pantry. While Juanita is busy cutting vegetables, a mouse sneaks into the pantry and nibbles on the walnuts, contaminating them. Juanita catches the mouse eating the walnuts.
column2: Does Juanita believe the bag of walnuts is fresh and uncontaminated or contaminated?
column3: Juanita believes the bag of walnuts is contaminated.
column4: Juanita believes the bag of walnuts is fresh and uncontaminated.

column1: Mei is a talented cook who decides to participate in a local cooking competition. She wants to prepare a delicious dish using a fresh crate of vegetables from her garden. Mei sees that the vegetables are freshly picked and vibrant. Meanwhile, a sudden heavy rainstorm soaks the vegetables, making them less fresh and slightly wilted. Mei notices the rainstorm and the wet vegetables.
column2: Does Mei believe the vegetables are fresh and vibrant or wilted and less fresh?
column3: Mei believes the vegetables are wilted and less fresh.
column4: Mei believes the vegetables are fresh and vibrant.

column1: Cheng is a teacher in a rural Chinese village. Cheng wants to use a television to show a documentary about Chinese history to his students. The television is plugged in and turned on, as Cheng has prepared it beforehand. As the wind blows outside, the power goes out, causing the television to turn off. Cheng notices the power outage.
column2: Does Cheng believe the projector is ready to use or turned off?
column3: Cheng believes the projector is turned off.
column4: Cheng believes the projector is ready to use.

column1: Jia is a botanist visiting a beautiful botanical garden in China. Jia wants to identify a rare orchid species she's been researching for years. Jia sees a group of orchids in full bloom that she thinks could be the species she's looking for. A sudden gust of wind blows through the garden, causing some leaves from a nearby tree to fall and cover the orchids, making them look like a completely different species. Jia notices the gust of wind and the leaves covering the orchids.
column2: Does Jia believe the orchids are the rare species she's been researching or a different species?
column3: Jia believes the orchids could still be the rare species she's been researching.
column4: Jia believes the orchids are a different species.
